description:
mitrovic

Go back a couple of versions for the easy to use switch from code edit to view mode. For some odd reason the latest versions don't support that.

If you want to write an eBook, this is a really great option. Good, clean, well-organized. You can switch between wysiwyg and code. You can do normal searches as well as regular expressions (super helpful in certain circumstances).

It was one of the greatest and easier apps to create or edit ebooks until they removed the book view and now you can do it only by xhtml. 

So 3 stars is a lot of more than it deserves for now.
summary: It was one of the greatest app until they removed book view

Sigil has been my goto app for editing epub files for years, and it's only got better (though having an external xhtml editor if you don't want html view is a bit irritating). Unfortunately the sigil team don't create linux versions but require the distro maintainer to compile and release which is why Ubuntu is stuck on ver 1.1 while the current release is 1.4.3 (3 Dec 2020)
summary: If you are creating ebooks this is a must have
